Terms of Use for Policy for Agora:

Overview of Agora

Agora is part of the GMC’s new data strategy. It’s a reporting system that brings all our key data together and lets us analyse it more effectively and produce better reports.

We want all GMC staff to try using the new Agora reporting system as part of a trial launch. It’s not ready to be used for everyday work just yet though and can’t be shared with anyone externally. By testing it out, you can help feed into the next phase and prepare for Agora’s eventual day to day use and external launch.

Purpose of this document

The purpose of this document is to explain how the Agora reporting system can be used during the phase 1 trial. You should read this document alongside the GMC’s Acceptable Use Policy and Data Protection Policy. It’s important you understand that these policies will apply to all uses of the Agora system.

Who will have access to Agora

The reporting system will be available to everyone at the GMC including all employees, contractors, associates and temporary workers.

How you can use Agora

During this trial phase all users can:

  • Use Agora to help us trial, develop and improve the system by viewing reports.
  • Discuss the reports internally with GMC colleagues.
What you can't do with Agora

You must use Agora in line with our Acceptable Use Policy which covers use of all GMC systems. For the avoidance of doubt, all users should:

  • Ensure that you do not identify individual doctors by linking data in Agora with any other information. Agora has been designed to provide a view of our data at aggregate level – not to show details about particular doctors.

Further to the general terms of use set out in the Acceptable Use Policy, you must not:

  • Share or discuss any data from Agora outside of the GMC for any reason, unless authorised to do so. This includes any observations about statistics that you view, download or share internally for the purposes of trialing Agora.
  • Share or discuss the Agora reporting system with anyone outside the GMC unless authorised to do so. This includes your opinions about the system.
  • Use the Agora reports to support your everyday work eg to include some statistics in an internal presentation. The data isn’t ready to be used in your day to day work during this trial phase.
Monitoring

We may need to monitor and audit use of the system for security, compliance and maintenance purposes.
